post_title: Giving foods and clothes to Orphanage
post_text: For every birthday of mine as well as my friends i would like visit the near by orphanages and give them foods and used clothes to them, for this we collect clothes from friend circle and will give them in big lot ! giving oneday food to those persons mean alot..its more than getting blessing from god.

post_title: Donated My Blood for Someone's Life
post_text: Once i was returning from highway no 5.i suddenly saw a truck driver who had banged his truck against a wall.The steering had pierced his chest.he was crying for  4 help and nobody was there to help him.I stopped my bike and rushed to help him. He said-i am going to die,so leave me.I said-uncle-u will see the sunshine of tomorrow.Then i dragged him out of his truck,made him sit on my bike...then i drove him to Bhubaneswar Capital Hospital where he got first aid thank god his blood group was A+ and mine was also A+, So i was able to donate him blood.Upto till date he is smiling like hell and always waving hand to me whenever i am driving my bike in NH 5.i can never forget that smile of gratitude in his face.i luv him...as my fate which compelled me to do something out of unselfishness...dat changed my life!

Myself part of Bhumi a social welfare organisation use to have spending time with lot of Orphanages and Old Age homes.. serving their small small needs and seeing smile on their face give me real joy in my heart and no money can buy that joy :)

Their mother died in an accident that morning, they were barely 2 weeks old, stuck under a concrete barricade, we broke the barricade and freed them, made a shelter for them..its been a year now and all four puppies are healthy and happy.

post_title: Gave something which made some parents happy!!
post_text: My enemy who stole things he forgot to bring Box in exam and nobody gave him nothing because of his behaviour but i gave him and he scored high in that subject he thanked me :D

On way to college at 6a.m at the railway station.i see this blind couple struggling for directions to the train amidst all the hustle and bustle of people rushing for work and class.(you know how difficult it gets during peak hours)
With nobody to help them,i rush towards them and help them board the train safely.
those three words they said"god bless you" gave me a reason to smile all day long.

When I was going to the station, I saw a little girl selling roses at the signal.
She came to me and I simply told her to go away. But later she came back and I knew then that she was desperate for the money. The yellow roses had torn petals and they were all dried up. 
I saw that little look on her face and my heart sank. I knew just then that I needed to buy atleast one. I had just ten rupees.
She said that one of the roses is for 10, but I asked her to give two in that amount and so she did in the desperation.
Later I saw her across the street smiling at me. I called her back and gifted one of the roses to her. That smile of hers made my day.
After reaching the station, I was so overwhelmed, that I gave the rickshaw driver my second rose and he said he will never forget me.
These few minutes just showed me how blessed I am with a wonderful life full of luxury and comfort while the girl at the signal or the rickshaw driver have barely a family.
This made a big impact on me. I always try to make them smile but the smile that still the brightest in my eyes is the one of the flower girl :)

post_title: Helping children by buying some stuffs from them !!
post_text:
One day two small brothers(one's age may be 7 & another boy age may be 5) came to my house & tell us to buy some table cloth, my mom ask them why they are selling their product at this age all alone, then they replied that their father is not well & his landlord taken away his shop so we are clearing remaining stock by selling door to door..

Child was selling @ rs 100 per table cloth but my mom told the child for rs 80(as we are pure Indian cannot buy anything unless we bargain first)..

After hearing rs 80 younger brother said " bhai lele papa se keh denge ki humne rs 20 ka khana kha liya" After hearing that tears comes in my eyes and even in my mom's eyes b-coz they were so kind & agree to give us for rs 80 by lying to his father ..

My mom give him rs 100 for table cloth & extra rs10 for their chocolates..That whole day my heart was not in proper condition b-coz i was thinking about the dialogue of that small child which touches my heart..I pray god to make his father healthy & wealthy !!

I like to give some smile to those less fortunate..We all see small children with ruined clothes, dirty hair and blistered feet, around traffic lights, temples etc. I always keep few chocolates or biscuits in my car and hand them over to them whenever I cross one. The smile on their face , the look in their eyes makes me feel like an angel because they are so happy to receive something so unexpectedly..Its a Joy to Behold.
Everyday since the last 3 months i've been helping a blind girl to her office, it started as a good deed, but now i enjoy her company more than ever. and look forward to meeting her everyday :)

This incident is about a year old when I was about to visit Shiva temple, I saw a  child, he seemed to be weak, I had planned to buy milk but then I changed my thought and bought Energy (milk drink) for the child, he drank it in just seconds, I really felt blessed even before the visit to the temple.

I had this stray cat who comes to my place everyday. She looks frail and hungry with a sad face and incessant meows. I have realised that there is no point feeding one self when there is no 'sharing' of food. I have promised myself that before everytime I eat, I would satiate the hunger of atleast one living being that co-exists with me.

I'm a teacher and everyday i get some birthday sweets from my students. I don't eat them but i bring them home and i collect all those in a Ferror Rocher box. When it gets full I pack it nicely and gift them to the children who seem to  be begging around the road. Its so touching to see them loving the box of sweets and seeing them wide smile !

post_title: Common courtesies can change the world (!)
post_text: I just think if all of us can inculcate being thoughtful and compassionate in our everyday lives, our world (home/office/roads/pubs/etc) will just become a much better place. in time, it may have a ripple effect :) Yesterday, I waited and let an old man on a bicycle cross the road as cars impatiently honked behind me. I don't think its a great act of giving but hopefully it'll make someone think about why it is important to give the right of way to someone feeble and weaker.
No better joy than helping the one's whose hand don't feed them by a one who is fed good by their hand ! *Joy of Giving* Bliss!

On the 4th September 2012 I came to know through M.P. Educational Portal that a Teacher in a near by district was dying due to Kidney failure and had no financial support. He had two young daughters and a wife to attend to. I could not stop my self and send a couple of the school's parents to find out the details about the patient and by the time I could get him to Jabalpur he was practically dying. But today I am a happy man as he has been discharged from the hospital today all hail and hearty. I Thank You GOD. I am a happy man today.
It should be habit and not that everyone is doing so let us do. A habit that i every time help the needy to solve problems to the maximum possible extent. It should be done through the heart

I DONATE BLOOD ON REGULAR BASIS FROM TIME TO TIME @ EVERY 3 MONTHS INTERVAL. TILL DATE I HAVE DONATED IT 15 TIMES IN 4 YEARS. DONATING BLOOD REALLY HELPS FEEL BETTER B'COZ U DID A GOOD CAUSE, SAVED SOMEONE'S LIFE......MAYBE HE IS IN ARMY PROTECTING US OR AN ANEMIC OR CANCER PATIENT......GO ON GUYS KEEP ON DONATING BLOOD...!!!

It is at Zonal Training School, Hyderabad during 1985. We are the best friends came from different towns and states, with different languages love each other & ate in one place, sleeping together. While leaving Training School during 1985 before joining in different assigned jobs in Indian Railways, one very sad incidence was occurred, Shri G.Rama Subramanyam was died. We are all best friends, cried, wept like any thing while leaving and departing from this world at a very early age. After that we friends  are regularly every year meeting in one of my friend's house and remembering the incidence and sharing the sad incidence. This is a real story typing with heart & while I'm writing, 2 to 3 drops of tears are came from eye. Thank You for giving this opportunity and sharing my Memories with you … With Drops of Tears... Drops of Tears... Drops of Tears...!!!

No One knows benefits of Cow in several fields.

HUMANITY Benifits-
1.Cow protection brings happiness and protection in life.
2.Cow protection is most important business of human society.
MEDICAL Benifits-
(urine and dung) provide the right solutions for most of the diseases like-Aids,Ear,Nose,Eye,Diabetes,Heart Diseases etc.
Cow give us a message also to live a Simple and pollution free life.
So
Save Gau Mata Save Bharat.
Jai shree Krishana.

‘Blissfully yours!!’

God wants us to live like the grass. Even if it's stepped on, crushed, burned and cut; it always persists and grows back even greener and stronger! 

This write-up is dedicated to the person who has faced life as a challenge in itself, who has gone against the flow and has transcended the barriers of caste and religion to establish her blissful existence. She has emerged as victorious in her battle against the physical shortcomings and those worthless principles that stem the free-flow of life. Her life is a benchmark in itself which rejuvenates our souls the moment we relive those days. 

The love of my life, my dearest cousin, has literally done wonders with her life: it’s amazing to see her comeback when the chips were completely down and out. Affected with juvenile diabetes right from the age of 17, she had almost lost zeal for life when a magical twist descended to transform her outlook. She used to skip classes, omit meals, cut down on her re-creative measures; or in short she had given in to the atrocities of life, but GOD had scripted a fairy-tale of sorts where she was destined to be the princess. Things HAD to change and CHANGE at a rapid pace.

Thankfully it did. She used to sit around the corner brooding over her cursed life, waiting for the shutters of death to descend - when somebody made her realise that life isn’t about mourning or agonising, it’s about conquering the impediments and rising above all.

She was an extremely talented swimmer but her illness was pegging her back from going ahead with her ambition. She had almost lost it, when her trainer Majid, stepped into her life and reincarnated her spirit to walk along the steep slope without when thinking of losing balance. He inspired her to think beyond those trivial short-comings and galvanised her step towards experiencing life to the fullest. He used to spend hours with her in form of interaction, training, motivating and innovating newer avenues of life; he just wanted her to jump in with full vigour.

This had to come! She finally started responding to his heart-felt calls and ‘their’ dedication started yielding rich dividends soon after. It was under Majid, that she won her first inter-state woman’s freestyle championship where she conquered her unbearable pain to clinch the top-spot amidst the best in business; she was unstoppable. 

And as it was destined the bond of love added a new flavour to their cherished association. She was the happiest person in the world when Majid proposed to her on her 18th Birthday; her ‘cursed’ life was starting to smile upon her yet again.

But destiny had yet another twist in store. Our family was totally against an inter-caste marriage; in fact at one point of time, she was told to choose one: her family or Majid as the way ahead. Both mental and physical torture followed; the toughest phase of her life had slowly made its way.
She didn’t give up. Insurmountable indeed!!

She had put in her best effort in terms of establishing her views in-front of the elders in the family; but in vain.

My uncle had other plans; he had already started looking for alternative career options for his daughter. But she was determined.
She was locked up in a dark room for a couple days, but didn’t break down. She was no longer the ‘escapist’ Ananya: her spirit was indomitable.
She rode on her blistering confidence to reach the final rounds of the All-India under 25 - Swimming championship...and Majid was there with her. She returned with a smile; she hid the intriguing pain that was killing her from inside.
There came my master-plan! The PLAN that could have sounded bold at the outset, but in this end, it managed to soothe quite a few senses.

There were a few shocked faces in the crowd when she kissed Majid in open air. 
Who cares? She had found her reason to smile, she had found her true love....she had INDEED crushed all those confinements and raised the bars of her glorious ambition.
It is truly said that- Life isn't always fair, but it will eventually make you the person you were meant to be!
She once told me that- “You may never change a broken past, but you can change a broken future! Live life to the fullest. No regrets!” GOLDEN words Dea, it’s so very true!
Life is like a roller coaster, you have your ups and downs, your twists and turns, but at the end of the ride you are glad you rode it anyway. Salute to the spirit of mortality, Salute to the indomitable attributes of mankind – Bows! We are proud of you Dea. 
Congratulations on your new life, you have inspired MANY! GOD BLESS! And YES I am OVERJOYED to donate or rather GIFT her the reason to smile 

post_title: Helping Hands Are Always Better Then Saying Words
post_text: Human being cares & respects for other human being & also they support & treat them with food, shelter & clothes but, what about animals very few people in this world have respect & care for animals. I always donate half of my monthly income in Veterinary Hospital & Animal Care Shelter for there proper food, medicine & other facilities. Its a kind request please try to adopt animals like dog, cats etc. Just dont say try to do with your good heart. So, Helping Hands Are Always Better Then Saying Words.
There is nothing more refreshing, more inspiring, more wonderful than the smile on the face of someone you have just done something helpful for or when they receive a gift.

post_title: Joy is like a perfume, you can't spread it around without pouring a few drops on yourself.
post_text: As mentioned above, when ever I feel discouraged, disappointed or sorrow I look around me and find people with more problems than mine. This gives me strength that almighty has given me something I should distribute to others that is money or food. Even just giving for the sake of throwing is not enough. I think its my honor that I can give someone a little happiness. That is why I make sure when I am giving someone something I dont make them pity on their self instead I make them feel that I am kind of friend to them and they are just asking to me not begging.  Talking politely is really important to me and by that most of the time I hand-over some needy whenever I see someone. I use word "needy" instead of "beggar" so that I never behave superior to them. I think god has given us opportunity to show how much we can admire him and give to other what we have got.

post_title: gave food to a starving child
post_text: Yesterday I went to the laundry with my friend to collect her dress. There I saw a poor kid begging for food. His clothes were very shabby and, looking at his condition, it seemed like he hadn't eaten for quite a while.   My friend and I were moved by seeing him like that, so we decided to help by buying him some food. Unfortunately, there was no eatery or grocery store in the area.   We asked the boy to wait at the same place and promised him that we would be back before very long. We went to the next street and found a grocery store there. I bought some packets of biscuits.   When we returned to the laundry the boy was still standing there. When I gave the biscuits to him he was delighted and said he hadn't really expected up to come back! He took the biscuits, gave us a thankful smile, and started munching!   Seeing his happiness also made our day!

Life is the expression of the Reason for being. The Reason represents the intelligence that is within all things. For example, it is the power within a seed, when planted in the garden, grows step by step to the fulfilment of its reason for being. Everything has a purpose, a time and a season. Autumn is a wonderful example of the fulfilment of many plants as we enjoy the abundance of fruits and vegetables that are harvested at this time in the cycles or seasons of life.

I used to buy a lot of things in market (even though I don't need them) when some small or young boy/girl come & sell things. I feel good that they are not begging. They are working. Even though they are trying to sell things at higher cost. I love giving that way. That's my way of giving.

I AM MYSELF A STUDENT..I NEVER USE TO GET POCKET MONEY..BUT AS I HAVE STARTED GIVING TUITIONS AT HOME..WITH MY SMALL INCOME I TRY TO DONATE COPIES PENCIL RUBBER AND SMALL LITLLE THINGS SO THAT POOR KIDS CAN STUDY..EVEN MOTIVATE THEM TO STUDY
Everytime I see some Illiterate being cheated because he don't no how to read/write I always feel to teach them and make them stand on their own feet in this ungrateful world...

One day in my college I was on my scooty and roaming near the college canteen.. Since construction is going on in our campus so a large number of labour class people are living in the campus with their families. But on that one day I was alone and some 5-6 small labour family children of the age range between 2-6 years came to me saying "DIDI bhookh lagi he kuch khane ko dedo. " I was very much moved and thought of giving them a small treat for them at the canteen.. I made all of them sit in the canteen benches and went to the college bhaiya to ask him to give the kids something to eat. At first he was reluctant saying unko nahi khane ko dunga. wo bhut preshaan karte hein etc etc. Then I gave him a 100 ruppee note and said "Bhaiya see I am paying you for watever they eat. You just give them wat they want to have". Then they had 2 pranthas, some biscuits, tea and I also gave them few parle g packets to carry home for their family to eat.They sat with me for around 10-15 minutes but they were so happy that I was even more happy seeing the smiles and contentment on their faces. The smile and the thankfulness on their face was more than anything at that time. From then on till for another 1 year of my studies in the campus they met me a couple of times and each time I used to get them something or the other and they used to happily say "Didi ap fir kab aoge" and I was like don't worryy me jab b aungi tume acha acha khilaungi. The happiness on those small children's face was more than anything for me. :(
Now that I have completed my graduation I still miss those kids and their happy moments with me.. :(
I do not encourage child labor also i do not let exploit the children.

I was buying something at my neighbourhood bakery when I saw two street kids - a very young boy with his baby sister. The little boy tried to buy whatever he could with his Rs. 15, but his sister cried and really wanted a piece of cream cake. He asked the salesman if the cake piece could be given for Rs. 10 but the bakery people just said "No!" and told them to go.

I got irritated with the way the bakery people were treating these poor kids, and so, just as the brother and sister began walking away, I stopped them. I asked the little girl which cake she wanted - and then I bought four pieces - much to the surprise of the bakery people. I also bought them two Dairy Milk chocolates and two Frooty juice packets. The bakery person gave me the typical Indian question hand gesture and asked me why I was doing this.

I didn't know know those kids, but all I know is, when that little girl stopped crying and looked at me with an attempt to smile, I knew I did the right thing. Things we salaried people take for granted mean a lot more to the less fortunate. I'm not saying everybody doing this on a daily basis is the right way to go, but more often than not, a single act of kindness will only make you feel good about yourself more than the good it does to the person you just helped. And that's the 'Joy of giving'.
Found 150 rs lying on the road... Picked it up and searched for someone in need. Found an old labourer lifting bricks into the truck and gave it to him for food.
